aliases.name: Smile.jpg
aliases.meaning: Original filename of the cursed image

description.summary: DOCUMENTED FICTION: Smile Dog is a creepypasta about a supposedly cursed image of a Siberian Husky with an unsettling human-like smile. Created around 2008 on 4chan, this fictional story became one of the early foundational creepypastas in internet horror culture.
description.full: Smile Dog (Smile.jpg) is a fictional creepypasta that originated around 2008 on 4chan's /x/ (paranormal) board. The story describes a cursed image depicting a Siberian Husky with an unnaturally wide, human-like smile in a dark room, sometimes accompanied by a humanoid hand. According to the fictional narrative, viewing this image causes nightmares, psychological distress, and a compulsion to 'spread the word' by showing it to others. This is DOCUMENTED FICTION—a creative horror story that became an important part of early internet folklore and digital horror culture. There is no actual cursed image; Smile Dog represents a cultural phenomenon in online storytelling and meme evolution.

etymology.origin: The name 'Smile Dog' derives from the filename 'smile.jpg' in the original creepypasta story, referring to the disturbing smile on the dog's face in the fictional cursed image
etymology.meaning: Named for the unnatural human-like smile displayed by the dog in the story

fiction_notes.reality_status: This is entirely fictional creative content. No paranormal phenomenon exists.
fiction_notes.cultural_significance: Important example of early creepypasta canon and internet horror storytelling
fiction_notes.purpose: Entertainment and artistic expression through digital horror narrative

related_phenomena.name: Jeff the Killer
related_phenomena.description: Contemporary creepypasta with similar image-based horror

related_phenomena.name: Russian Sleep Experiment
related_phenomena.description: Another foundational creepypasta from the same era

described_image.subject: Siberian Husky
described_image.additional_elements: Sometimes described as showing a humanoid hand in frame
described_image.note: No single canonical image; various images have been associated with the story

narrative_effects.description: Victims reportedly experience recurring nightmares after viewing
General anxiety and paranoia in the narrative
Chain letter element: must show image to others to be free
Dog appears in dreams telling victims to 'spread the word'

range.description: FICTION: As a fictional story, Smile Dog exists only as an internet narrative distributed globally through forums, websites, and social media.

spread_pattern.mechanism: Viral sharing, forum reposts, YouTube readings
spread_pattern.ongoing_presence: Continues to circulate as classic creepypasta

cultural_reach.languages: Primarily English, translated to various languages
cultural_reach.demographics: Internet users, horror fans, particularly teenagers and young adults

origins.cultural_roots: Part of early creepypasta culture on 4chan and similar boards. Draws from chain letter traditions, cursed media tropes (e.g., The Ring/Ringu), and internet urban legends.
origins.creation_context: Emerged during the formative period of creepypasta as a genre (2007-2009), when users created fictional horror stories presented as true accounts
origins.folklore_connections: Connected to broader traditions of cursed objects, haunted media, and memetic horror

timeline.significance: Story first appears on 4chan /x/, author anonymous or unknown
Story spreads to other forums and early creepypasta websites
Becomes one of the most well-known early creepypastas
Recognized as foundational creepypasta; continues to be shared and referenced

history.modern_era: Smile Dog remains a recognizable part of internet horror culture and is frequently referenced in discussions of creepypasta history. It represents an important artifact of early digital horror storytelling.

traditions: Chain letter tradition adapted to internet age
Cursed object folklore in digital format
folklore.narrative_structure: Presented as interview/investigation of urban legend
folklore.beliefs: FICTION: No actual beliefs—this is recognized as creative fiction by most audiences

literature: Referenced in internet horror fiction guides
media: Video game Easter eggs and references
impact: Contributed to establishing creepypasta as a genre
Part of broader internet horror culture

internet_culture.significance: Foundational creepypasta that helped define the genre
internet_culture.meme_status: Recognized meme in horror and internet culture circles
internet_culture.community: Active discussion and creation in creepypasta communities
internet_culture.artistic_expression: Inspired fan art, derivative stories, and creative interpretations

academic_interest.focus: Study of how folklore adapts to digital spaces
Evolution of memes and viral content
Digital horror and new horror narratives

analytical_frameworks.name: Memetic Horror
analytical_frameworks.description: Analysis of how horror spreads through viral sharing and adaptation
analytical_frameworks.application: Examines Smile Dog as self-replicating horror narrative

analytical_frameworks.name: Digital Folklore Evolution
analytical_frameworks.description: How traditional folklore adapts to internet platforms
analytical_frameworks.application: Traces connection to chain letters and cursed object legends

analytical_frameworks.name: Participatory Horror
analytical_frameworks.description: Community-driven creation and evolution of horror narratives
analytical_frameworks.application: Examines how communities shape and reshape the story

cultural_analysis.description: Story reflects fears about viral content and loss of control online
Demonstrates internet's capacity for collaborative storytelling
Updates traditional folklore formats for digital age

sources.title: Smile Dog / Smile.jpg
sources.description: Documentation of the meme's history and spread

disclaimers.primary: THIS IS DOCUMENTED FICTION. Smile Dog is a creative work of horror fiction (creepypasta) created for entertainment purposes. There is no actual cursed image, no paranormal phenomenon, and no supernatural effects from viewing any image.
disclaimers.educational_purpose: This documentation exists to preserve internet culture history and analyze digital folklore as an academic and cultural artifact.
disclaimers.no_paranormal_claims: The Wyrdness Project documents this as FICTION to distinguish it from phenomena where paranormal claims are made. This entry serves educational and archival purposes.
